class.name: StyleBox
class.brief_description: Base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI.
class.description: StyleBox is [Resource] that provides an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI. StyleBoxes are used for drawing the styles of buttons, line edit backgrounds, tree backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a StyleBox assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below. [b]Note:[/b] For children of [Control] that have [i]Theme Properties[/i], the [code]focus[/code] [StyleBox] is displayed over the [code]normal[/code], [code]hover[/code] or [code]pressed[/code] [StyleBox]. This makes the [code]focus[/code] [StyleBox] more reusable across different nodes.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draws this stylebox using a [CanvasItem] with given [RID]. You can get a [RID] value using [method Object.get_instance_id] on a [CanvasItem]-derived node.

method.name: get_center_size
method.description: Returns the size of this [StyleBox] without the margins.

method.name: get_current_item_drawn
method.description: Returns the [CanvasItem] that handles its [constant CanvasItem.NOTIFICATION_DRAW] or [method CanvasItem._draw] callback at this moment.

method.name: get_default_margin
method.description: Returns the default margin of the specified [enum Side].

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Returns the content margin offset for the specified [enum Side]. Positive values reduce size inwards, unlike [Control]'s margin values.

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Returns the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the "offset" of a stylebox. This helper function returns a value equivalent to [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].

method.name: set_default_margin
method.description: Sets the default value of the specified [enum Side] to [code]offset[/code] pixels.

method.name: test_mask
method.description: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.

members.member: The bottom margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the bottom. If this value is negative, it is ignored and a child-specific margin is used instead. For example for [StyleBoxFlat] the border thickness (if any) is used instead. It is up to the code using this style box to decide what these contents are: for example, a [Button] respects this content margin for the textual contents of the button. [method get_margin] should be used to fetch this value as consumer instead of reading these properties directly. This is because it correctly respects negative values and the fallback mentioned above.
The left margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the left. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.

The right margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the right. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.
The top margin for the contents of this style box. Increasing this value reduces the space available to the contents from the top. Refer to [member content_margin_bottom] for extra considerations.
